page.title: 19RECREATION: THE GOLF CLUB.
page.content: A major aspect of land use in this area concerns recreation; especially that of numerous cricket and golf clubs in Bowdon, Hale and Ashley. Typical of such clubs on the fringe of these richer suburbs is{Ringway Golf {Club, Hale Barns.}In l984 this particular club celebrated its 75th. anniversary. In l929 the club occupied ll2 acres next to Easterlane Farm on Ashley Road, but was only made into l8 holes in l960. Nevertheless it is a popular and competitive club with many social functions, a demanding course and prizes awarded for snooker and bowls as well as golf. The Committee maintains the rural character of the area by planting trees and shrubs; not just to protect nearby houses! The modernised club house and large mixed lounge overlooks sycamore, oaks, silver birch and the hills beyond.
